title: Your Friday Briefing: Mass Shooting in Thailand
description: Plus growing dissent in Russia and China’s debt diplomacy

title: Blunt Criticism of Russian Army Signals New Challenge for Putin
description: An official in a Russian-occupied region of Ukraine suggested Russia’s defense minister should shoot himself because of his army’s failings, an unusually blunt and public rebuke of Kremlin leadership.

title: UN’s Nuclear Agency Rejects Russia’s Claim to Zaporizhzhia Plant
description: Russia says it is nationalizing and taking over operational control of the six-reactor plant, which its troops captured in March but which Ukrainian engineers have continued to operate.

title: Ukrain Police Find Bodies of 534 Civilians in Recaptured Territory
description: The police have discovered 22 locations that they suspect were used as torture chambers in areas recently reclaimed from Russian control, a Ukrainian official said.

title: Truss Meets With European Leaders, Signaling Thaw in Relations
description: Brexit still needs some ironing out, but Prime Minister Liz Truss’s government seems to be warming to working with Europe.

title: Annie Ernaux Is Awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature
description: Ernaux’s writing has spoken particularly to women and to others who, like her, come from a working class seldom depicted with such clarity in literature.

title: Annie Ernaux’s Work Dissecting the Deeply Personal Is Awarded the Nobel
description: Ernaux’s writing has spoken particularly to women and to others who, like her, come from a working class seldom depicted with such clarity in literature.

title: New E.U. Sanctions Against Russia Lay Out a Cap on Oil Prices
description: The measures come in response to Moscow’s recent escalation of the war, and a day after global oil producers decided to cut Russia’s crude supply, increasing its value on the world market.

title: ‘Geniuses’ Versus the Guns: a Campus Crackdown Shocks Iran
description: Universities across Iran have erupted in protests after more than decade of being politically dormant, with students joining the unrest that has convulsed the country for the past three weeks.

title: U.S. Forces Target an ISIS Leader in Syria, Officials Say
description: The nighttime raid was a rare operation inside Syrian government territory, a Kurdish security official said.

title: Didier Eribon on Ernaux: She captured ‘in one sentence what I couldn’t say in a page.’
description: The French philosopher and sociologist said that Ernaux had always been “a great personal inspiration.”

title: The head of the U.N.’s nuclear agency is visiting Kyiv to discuss security at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant.
China Turns Back Move for U.N. Debate on Abuse of Uyghurs
description: Western countries were seeking to discuss a landmark U.N. report on China’s treatment of Uyghurs and other Muslims in the Xinjiang region

title: Swedish Investigators Say Pipeline Leaks Evidence Points to Sabotage
U.S. Health Officials Urge Vigilance as Ebola Spreads in Uganda
description: There are no cases in the United States, but the C.D.C. wants doctors to be on the alert for patients with telltale symptoms.

title: Brittney Griner’s Wife Says They’ve Had 2 Phone Calls Since Arrest
description: Cherelle Griner described the second conversation with her wife, the W.N.B.A. star detained in Russia since February, as “the most disturbing phone call I’d ever experienced.”

title: Two Migrant Boats Sink Off Greece; More Than 20 Believed Drowned
description: Rescue operations were underway for those still believed to be missing amid high winds in the Aegean Sea, the Greek Coast Guard said.

title: Mass Shootings Are Rare Outside The United States
description: Compared with the rest of the world, the U.S. also has far more such attacks that take place at schools.

title: Japanese Filmmaker Toru Kubota Sentenced to 10 Years in Myanmar
description: A military court claimed that the 26-year-old documentarian violated immigration law and participated in protests against the regime.

title: The U.S. believes Ukrainians were behind Daria Dugina’s assassination.
The Politics of Grievance
description: We look at Italy, the largest country in western Europe to elect a far-right government in decades.

title: Gun Ownership is Common in Thailand, But Shootings Are Not
description: In a country with millions of firearms, the authorities have long worried about the potential for more gun violence.

title: Live Updates: More Than 30 Killed at Child-Care Center in Thailand
description: Twenty-four children were among those killed in the mass shooting, according to local media.

title: Scandinavia Offers Hints for Achieving Successful Democracies
description: Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark consistently rate highly on scales assessing democratic health, but it’s not easy to replicate their systems.

title: Yascha Mounk on What Democracy Needs to Survive
description: The author and educator explains that making diverse democracies work is difficult and offers suggestions on how they can succeed.

title: Kathmandu Finally Got Tap Water. After a Climate Disaster, It Was Gone.
description: A disaster that wiped out a decades-long project to bring pipe-borne water to Nepal’s capital shows the mismatch between slow-moving donor-financed efforts and rapid global warming.

title: Four Young Leaders Explain Their Roles in the Global Democracy Movement
description: Four young leaders explain how they became involved in the global democracy movement and what they have learned so far.

title: A Time of Unease and Challenge for Democracy
description: With many nations wary of the leadership of the United States, the war in Ukraine poses a test for the West.

title: With Ukraine War, Europe’s Democratic Project Takes on New Urgency
description: Panelists at the Athens Democracy Forum said Putin’s invasion has provided a striking example of the importance and power of the democratic idea.

title: TikTok, Fake News and Obstacles to the Ballot Box
description: Last week, experts convened in Athens to discuss disinformation, misinformation and other threats to democracy.

title: In Greece, Democracy and Theater Were Closely Intertwined
description: In ancient Greece the great playwrights helped to plant and nurture the seeds of representative government through their characters and plots.

title: In Algeria, Veiled From the World, Past and Future Are Shrouded, Too
description: A land of thwarted potential, the country fends off outside influences, political change and some of its own history.

title: Thailand Mass Shooting: More Than 30 Killed, Including Children
description: The attack happened at a child-care facility, and the victims include both children and adults.

title: U.N. Agency Renews Plea to Secure Nuclear Plant After Russian Takeover
description: Since President Vladimir V. Putin nationalized the Zaporizhzhia facility, its safety has taken on new urgency, the head of the nuclear watchdog said.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: OPEC’s decision to curb oil production.

title: 视觉调查：李文亮医生的最后时刻
description: 时报的视觉调查团队审阅了李文亮的医疗记录，独家采访了一位目击了抢救过程的医生，揭示了关于李文亮病情和死亡的重要新细节。

title: North Korea Launches 2 Ballistic Missiles, Condemning UN Meeting
description: They marked the 24th weapons test by the isolated country this year, and came days after Pyongyang fired a missile over Japan for the first time since 2017.

title: Macron’s European Political Community Debuts in the Shadow of War
description: The French president envisions the European Political Community as a bold way for an independent Europe to flex its muscle. Whether Europe will follow his lead is unclear.

title: Some Unlikely Dealers Are Selling Weapons to Ukraine
description: New brokers are cashing in as the Biden administration quietly encourages private weapons sales to Ukraine. Oversight is scant in these shadows.

title: Inside the Final Days of the Doctor China Tried to Silence
description: A New York Times video investigation reveals new details about Dr. Li Wenliang’s illness and death from Covid-19 based on medical records and an exclusive interview with a key witness.

title: The Final Days of Li Wenliang, the Doctor China Tried to Silence
description: A New York Times video investigation reveals new details about the death of Dr. Li Wenliang, a national hero who faced censorship after sounding an early alarm on Covid-19.

title: Patricia Cloherty, Trailblazing Venture Capitalist, Dies at 80
description: A logger’s daughter, she was among the first women to thrive in the high-risk, high-reward field and a key backer of fledgling Russian companies in the 1990s.

title: In Retreat at the Front, Russia Strikes Deep Into Ukraine With Drones
description: In an attack in central Ukraine, Russian forces used what Ukrainians said were Iranian-made drones acquired by Moscow as its own arsenal dwindles.

title: OPEC Move Shows the Limits of Biden’s Fist-Bump Diplomacy With the Saudis
description: OPEC’s decision to curb oil production was a signal that President Biden’s influence over his Gulf allies was far less than he had hoped.
